name: To Kill a Mockingbird
abstract: Harper Lee's novel explores racial injustice in the Deep South through the eyes of young Scout Finch, whose father, lawyer Atticus Finch, defends a black man falsely accused of raping a white woman.
George Orwell's dystopian novel depicts a totalitarian society under constant surveillance, where independent thought is suppressed, and history is manipulated by the Party led by Big Brother.

name: Pride and Prejudice
abstract: Jane Austen's classic novel follows Elizabeth Bennet as she navigates issues of manners, morality, and marriage in the society of the British gentry of the early 19th century.

name: The Great Gatsby
abstract: F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel portrays the decadence and excess of the Jazz Age through the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.

name: Moby-Dick
abstract: Herman Melville's epic tale follows Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to hunt the white whale Moby Dick, exploring themes of fate, revenge, and the human condition.

name: War and Peace
abstract: Leo Tolstoy's monumental novel chronicles the lives of Russian aristocrats against the backdrop of the Napoleonic Wars, delving into themes of fate, free will, and the tumult of history.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
abstract: J.D. Salinger's novel follows teenage protagonist Holden Caulfield as he experiences alienation and disillusionment in 1950s New York City.

name: The Lord of the Rings
abstract: J.R.R. Tolkien's epic fantasy trilogy follows hobbit Frodo Baggins and his companions on a quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the dark lord Sauron.

name: Jane Eyre
abstract: Charlotte Brontë's novel tells the story of the resilient governess Jane Eyre, her growth to adulthood, and her complex relationship with the enigmatic Mr. Rochester.

name: Crime and Punishment
abstract: Fyodor Dostoevsky's novel explores the psychological turmoil of Raskolnikov, a destitute student who commits a murder and grapples with guilt and redemption.

name: The Brothers Karamazov
abstract: Dostoevsky's final novel delves into the lives of the Karamazov brothers, exploring themes of faith, doubt, and the nature of free will.

name: Wuthering Heights
abstract: Emily Brontë's novel is a tale of passion, revenge, and the destructive nature of love, centered on the tumultuous relationship between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.

name: Great Expectations
abstract: Charles Dickens' novel follows the life of Pip, an orphan who aspires to rise above his humble beginnings, encountering a cast of memorable characters along the way.

name: Anna Karenina
abstract: Leo Tolstoy's novel tells the tragic story of Anna Karenina, a married aristocrat who embarks on a doomed affair with the dashing Count Vronsky.

name: Madame Bovary
abstract: Gustave Flaubert's novel chronicles the life of Emma Bovary, a doctor's wife who seeks escape from provincial life through romantic fantasies and extramarital affairs.

name: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
abstract: Mark Twain's novel follows young Huck Finn as he journeys down the Mississippi River with Jim, an escaped slave, confronting issues of race and identity.

name: The Iliad
abstract: Attributed to Homer, this ancient epic poem recounts the events of the Trojan War, focusing on the hero Achilles and themes of honor, wrath, and fate.

name: The Odyssey
abstract: Homer's epic poem follows the hero Odysseus as he embarks on a perilous journey home after the Trojan War, encountering mythical creatures and divine challenges.

name: One Hundred Years of Solitude
abstract: Gabriel García Márquez's masterpiece chronicles the multi-generational saga of the Buendía family in the mythical town of Macondo, blending reality and magical realism.

name: The Divine Comedy
abstract: Dante Alighieri's epic poem describes the author's journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise, exploring themes of sin, redemption, and divine justice.

name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
abstract: Oscar Wilde's novel tells the story of Dorian Gray, a handsome young man who remains youthful while his portrait ages, reflecting his moral corruption.

name: Don Quixote
abstract: Miguel de Cervantes' novel follows the misadventures of Don Quixote, a nobleman who becomes a self-styled knight-errant in pursuit of chivalrous ideals.

name: The Grapes of Wrath
abstract: John Steinbeck's novel depicts the struggles of the Joad family as they migrate westward during the Great Depression in search of a better life.

name: The Old Man and the Sea
abstract: Ernest Hemingway's novella tells the story of an aging Cuban fisherman who engages in an epic battle with a giant marlin.

name: The Sound and the Fury
abstract: William Faulkner's novel presents the decline of the Compson family through multiple perspectives and a stream-of-consciousness narrative.

name: Lolita
abstract: Vladimir Nabokov's controversial novel explores the obsession of Humbert Humbert, a middle-aged man, with Dolores Haze, a twelve-year-old girl he nicknames Lolita.

name: Catch-22
abstract: Joseph Heller's satirical novel follows Captain John Yossarian, a World War II bombardier, as he confronts the absurdities of war and military bureaucracy.

name: The Metamorphosis
abstract: Franz Kafka's novella tells the story of Gregor Samsa, a traveling salesman who awakens one morning to find himself transformed into a giant insect.

name: The Trial
abstract: Kafka's novel follows Josef K., a man who is arrested and prosecuted by an enigmatic legal system without ever knowing his crime, exploring themes of bureaucracy and existential dread.

name: Brave New World
abstract: Aldous Huxley's dystopian novel depicts a future society controlled through technology, genetic engineering, and pleasure, questioning the cost of stability and happiness.

name: Fahrenheit 451
abstract: Ray Bradbury's novel presents a future where books are banned, and 'firemen' burn them, following protagonist Guy Montag as he begins to question the system.

name: Slaughterhouse-Five
abstract: Kurt Vonnegut's novel follows Billy Pilgrim, a World War II soldier who becomes 'unstuck in time,' experiencing moments of his life in a nonlinear fashion.

name: Beloved
abstract: Toni Morrison's novel explores the haunting legacy of slavery through the story of Sethe, a former slave whose home is visited by the ghost of her dead daughter.

name: Invisible Man
abstract: Ralph Ellison's novel follows an unnamed Black narrator as he navigates racism and identity in 20th-century America.

name: The Stranger
abstract: Albert Camus' novel follows Meursault, a detached and indifferent man, as he commits a senseless murder and confronts existential meaninglessness.

name: Les Misérables
abstract: Victor Hugo's epic novel follows Jean Valjean, a former convict seeking redemption while being pursued by the relentless Inspector Javert in revolutionary France.

name: Dracula
abstract: Bram Stoker's classic gothic novel tells the story of Count Dracula's attempt to spread vampirism in England and the efforts to stop him.

name: Frankenstein
abstract: Mary Shelley's novel tells the story of Victor Frankenstein, a scientist who creates a sentient creature, leading to tragic consequences.

name: The Count of Monte Cristo
abstract: Alexandre Dumas' novel follows Edmond Dantès, who is wrongfully imprisoned and escapes to seek revenge on those who betrayed him.

name: A Tale of Two Cities
abstract: Charles Dickens' historical novel is set during the French Revolution, exploring themes of sacrifice, resurrection, and justice.

name: Ulysses
abstract: James Joyce's modernist novel follows Leopold Bloom over the course of a single day in Dublin, experimenting with language and narrative structure.

name: The Sun Also Rises
abstract: Ernest Hemingway's novel explores the post-World War I 'Lost Generation' through the travels of expatriates in Spain.

name: On the Road
abstract: Jack Kerouac's novel follows Sal Paradise and Dean Moriarty as they embark on road trips across America, capturing the Beat Generation spirit.

name: The Bell Jar
abstract: Sylvia Plath's semi-autobiographical novel depicts the mental breakdown of Esther Greenwood as she struggles with identity and societal expectations.

name: East of Eden
abstract: John Steinbeck's novel explores the intertwining lives of two families in California, delving into themes of good and evil.

name: The Hobbit
abstract: J.R.R. Tolkien's fantasy novel follows Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who embarks on an adventure with a group of dwarves to reclaim their homeland.

name: Dune
abstract: Frank Herbert's science fiction novel follows Paul Atreides as he navigates political intrigue and prophecy on the desert planet Arrakis.

name: Foundation
abstract: Isaac Asimov's novel explores the rise and fall of civilizations through the predictions of psychohistory, centering on the Foundation's efforts to preserve knowledge.

name: Neuromancer
abstract: William Gibson's cyberpunk novel follows Case, a hacker hired for a dangerous job in a world of artificial intelligence and cyberspace.

name: The Left Hand of Darkness
abstract: Ursula K. Le Guin's novel explores themes of gender and identity through the story of an ambassador visiting an alien planet where inhabitants can change sex.

name: The Road
abstract: Cormac McCarthy's novel follows a father and son traveling through a post-apocalyptic America, struggling to survive and maintain their humanity.

name: The Handmaid's Tale
abstract: Margaret Atwood's dystopian novel depicts a future where women are subjugated under a theocratic regime, following the experiences of Offred, a Handmaid.

name: A Clockwork Orange
abstract: Anthony Burgess' novel explores free will and morality through the story of Alex, a violent youth subjected to government reformation.

name: Blood Meridian
abstract: Cormac McCarthy's novel follows 'the Kid' as he joins a group of mercenaries hunting Native Americans in a brutal vision of the American West.

name: The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle
abstract: Haruki Murakami's novel follows Toru Okada as he searches for his missing wife, encountering surreal events and mysterious figures.

name: Norwegian Wood
abstract: Haruki Murakami's novel tells a nostalgic love story set in 1960s Tokyo, following the relationships of college student Toru Watanabe.

name: White Teeth
abstract: Zadie Smith's novel explores multiculturalism, immigration, and identity through the lives of two families in London.

name: Midnight’s Children
abstract: Salman Rushdie's novel tells the story of Saleem Sinai, who is born at the exact moment of India's independence and possesses telepathic powers.

name: The Shadow of the Wind
abstract: Carlos Ruiz Zafón's novel follows Daniel, who discovers a mysterious book and uncovers a literary mystery in post-war Barcelona.

name: Life of Pi
abstract: Yann Martel's novel tells the story of Pi Patel, who survives a shipwreck and is stranded in a lifeboat with a Bengal tiger.

name: Cloud Atlas
abstract: David Mitchell's novel interweaves six narratives across time, exploring themes of reincarnation and interconnectedness.

name: The Night Circus
abstract: Erin Morgenstern's novel follows two young magicians who compete in a mysterious circus, unaware of the consequences of their rivalry.

name: The Goldfinch
abstract: Donna Tartt's novel follows Theo Decker, whose life is shaped by a tragic event and his obsession with a stolen painting.

name: The Underground Railroad
abstract: Colson Whitehead's novel reimagines the Underground Railroad as a literal railway system, following Cora as she escapes slavery.

name: Lincoln in the Bardo
abstract: George Saunders' novel blends history and the supernatural as President Lincoln mourns the death of his son in a graveyard inhabited by ghosts.

name: Where the Crawdads Sing
abstract: Delia Owens' novel follows Kya, the 'Marsh Girl,' who grows up isolated in the North Carolina marshlands and becomes embroiled in a murder case.
